name: Soil-infused Mushroom Risotto
instructions: 1. In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic and cook until they become soft and translucent.
2. Add the sliced mushrooms to the pan and cook until they begin to brown and release their moisture, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the Arborio rice to the pan and stir it well, coating it with the olive oil and mushrooms.

4. Gradually add the vegetable or chicken broth, about 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly until the liquid is absorbed before adding more. Continue this process until all the broth is used, and the rice has a creamy consistency. This should take about 20-25 minutes.
5. Once the rice is cooked and creamy, remove the pan from the heat and stir in the grated Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Let the risotto rest for a few minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.
description: Soil-infused Mushroom Risotto is a delicious and creamy dish made with Arborio rice cooked in vegetable or chicken broth. Sliced mushrooms are added for a rich and earthy flavor, while grated Parmesan cheese adds a touch of creaminess and saltiness.
